intro: Urena haenkeana, commonly known as the redroot false flax, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters in height, characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in the summer months. Its seeds are enclosed in pods that split open when mature, dispersing the seeds by wind. Urena haenkeana is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
